<ce:section-title>Synthesis of <mml:math altimg="si1.gif" overflow="scroll">
<mml:mrow>
<mml:mo stretchy="false">[</mml:mo>
<mml:mrow>
<mml:mi mathvariant="normal">Zn</mml:mi>
</mml:mrow>
<mml:mo stretchy="false">(</mml:mo>
<mml:mrow>
<mml:mi mathvariant="normal">atz</mml:mi>
</mml:mrow>
<mml:mo stretchy="false">)</mml:mo>
<mml:mo stretchy="false">(</mml:mo>
<mml:mrow>
<mml:mi mathvariant="normal">nic</mml:mi>
</mml:mrow>
<mml:mo stretchy="false">)</mml:mo>
<mml:msub>
<mml:mrow>
<mml:mo stretchy="false">]</mml:mo>
</mml:mrow>
<mml:mrow>
<mml:mi>n</mml:mi>
</mml:mrow>
</mml:msub>
<mml:mo stretchy="false">(</mml:mo>
<mml:mrow>
<mml:mn mathvariant="bold">1</mml:mn>
</mml:mrow>
<mml:mo stretchy="false">)</mml:mo>
</mml:mrow>
</mml:math>
</ce:section-title><ce:para view="all">A mixture of Zn(NO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·6H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (0.2975<ce:hsp sp="0.16"></ce:hsp>g, 1.0<ce:hsp sp="0.16"></ce:hsp>mmol), NaN<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf> (0.0325<ce:hsp sp="0.16"></ce:hsp>g, 0.5<ce:hsp sp="0.16"></ce:hsp>mmol), DCDA (DCDA=dicyandiamide, 0.042<ce:hsp sp="0.16"></ce:hsp>g, 0.5<ce:hsp sp="0.16"></ce:hsp>mmol), Hnic (0.122<ce:hsp sp="0.16"></ce:hsp>g, 1.0<ce:hsp sp="0.16"></ce:hsp>mmol) ethanol (2<ce:hsp sp="0.16"></ce:hsp>ml) and water (8<ce:hsp sp="0.16"></ce:hsp>ml) was stirred for 30<ce:hsp sp="0.16"></ce:hsp>min in air (
<ce:float-anchor refid="sch1"></ce:float-anchor>), then sealed in a 23<ce:hsp sp="0.16"></ce:hsp>ml Teflon autoclave and heated at 130<ce:hsp sp="0.16"></ce:hsp>°C for 3 days. After the sample was cooled to room temperature at a rate of 10<ce:hsp sp="0.16"></ce:hsp>°C/h, colorless lamellar crystals were obtained in ca. 38% yield based on Zn. Anal. found: C, 31.03%; H, 2.21%; N, 30.91%. Calcd for Zn<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>C<ce:inf loc="post">14</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">12</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">12</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf> (MW=543.10): C, 30.96%; H, 2.23%; N, 30.95%.</ce:para><ce:section-title>Synthesis of <mml:math altimg="si2.gif" overflow="scroll">
<mml:mrow>
<mml:mo stretchy="false">[</mml:mo>
<mml:mrow>
<mml:mi mathvariant="normal">Zn</mml:mi>
</mml:mrow>
<mml:mo stretchy="false">(</mml:mo>
<mml:mrow>
<mml:mi mathvariant="normal">atz</mml:mi>
</mml:mrow>
<mml:mo stretchy="false">)</mml:mo>
<mml:mo stretchy="false">(</mml:mo>
<mml:mrow>
<mml:mi mathvariant="normal">isonic</mml:mi>
</mml:mrow>
<mml:mo stretchy="false">)</mml:mo>
<mml:msub>
<mml:mrow>
<mml:mo stretchy="false">]</mml:mo>
</mml:mrow>
<mml:mrow>
<mml:mi>n</mml:mi>
</mml:mrow>
</mml:msub>
<mml:mo>·</mml:mo>
<mml:mi>n</mml:mi>
<mml:mo stretchy="false">(</mml:mo>
<mml:mrow>
<mml:mi mathvariant="normal">Hisonic</mml:mi>
</mml:mrow>
<mml:mo stretchy="false">)</mml:mo>
<mml:mo stretchy="false">(</mml:mo>
<mml:mrow>
<mml:mn mathvariant="bold">2</mml:mn>
</mml:mrow>
<mml:mo stretchy="false">)</mml:mo>
</mml:mrow>
</mml:math>
</ce:section-title><ce:para view="all">The hydrothermal procedure for the preparation of complex <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> is similar to that for <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> except by replacement of Hnic with Hisonic. Colorless pillar crystals were obtained in ca. 46% yield based on Zn. Anal. found: C, 35.53%; H, 2.21%; N, 28.81%. Calcd for ZnC<ce:inf loc="post">10</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">8</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">7</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf> (MW=339.60): C, 35.36%; H, 2.37%; N, 28.87%.</ce:para><ce:section-title>Synthesis of <mml:math altimg="si3.gif" overflow="scroll">
<mml:mrow>
<mml:mo stretchy="false">[</mml:mo>
<mml:mrow>
<mml:mi mathvariant="normal">Cd</mml:mi>
</mml:mrow>
<mml:mo stretchy="false">(</mml:mo>
<mml:mrow>
<mml:mi mathvariant="normal">atz</mml:mi>
</mml:mrow>
<mml:mo stretchy="false">)</mml:mo>
<mml:mo stretchy="false">(</mml:mo>
<mml:mrow>
<mml:mi mathvariant="normal">isonic</mml:mi>
</mml:mrow>
<mml:mo stretchy="false">)</mml:mo>
<mml:msub>
<mml:mrow>
<mml:mo stretchy="false">]</mml:mo>
</mml:mrow>
<mml:mrow>
<mml:mi>n</mml:mi>
</mml:mrow>
</mml:msub>
<mml:mo stretchy="false">(</mml:mo>
<mml:mrow>
<mml:mn mathvariant="bold">3</mml:mn>
</mml:mrow>
<mml:mo stretchy="false">)</mml:mo>
</mml:mrow>
</mml:math>
</ce:section-title><ce:para view="all">Similarly, complex <ce:bold>3</ce:bold> was prepared in the same manner as that for <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> but with Cd(NO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·2H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O to replace Zn(NO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·6H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O. Colorless pillar crystals were obtained in ca. 46% yield based on Cd. Anal. found: C, 26.41%; H, 1.88%; N, 26.31%. Calcd for CdC<ce:inf loc="post">7</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> (MW=318.58): C, 26.39%; H, 1.90%; N, 26.38%.</ce:para>
clean_text:
Synthesis of   [  Zn  (  atz  ) (  nic  )   ]   n   (  1  )   

A mixture of Zn(NO3)2⋅6H2O (0.2975g, 1.0mmol), NaN3 (0.0325g, 0.5mmol), DCDA (DCDA=dicyandiamide, 0.042g, 0.5mmol), Hnic (0.122g, 1.0mmol) ethanol (2ml) and water (8ml) was stirred for 30min in air ( ), then sealed in a 23ml Teflon autoclave and heated at 130°C for 3 days. After the sample was cooled to room temperature at a rate of 10°C/h, colorless lamellar crystals were obtained in ca. 38% yield based on Zn. Anal. found: C, 31.03%; H, 2.21%; N, 30.91%. Calcd for Zn2C14H12N12O4 (MW=543.10): C, 30.96%; H, 2.23%; N, 30.95%.

Synthesis of   [  Zn  (  atz  ) (  isonic  )   ]   n   ⋅ n (  Hisonic  ) (  2  )   

The hydrothermal procedure for the preparation of complex 2 is similar to that for 1 except by replacement of Hnic with Hisonic. Colorless pillar crystals were obtained in ca. 46% yield based on Zn. Anal. found: C, 35.53%; H, 2.21%; N, 28.81%. Calcd for ZnC10H8N7O3 (MW=339.60): C, 35.36%; H, 2.37%; N, 28.87%.

Synthesis of   [  Cd  (  atz  ) (  isonic  )   ]   n   (  3  )   

Similarly, complex 3 was prepared in the same manner as that for 2 but with Cd(NO3)2⋅2H2O to replace Zn(NO3)2⋅6H2O. Colorless pillar crystals were obtained in ca. 46% yield based on Cd. Anal. found: C, 26.41%; H, 1.88%; N, 26.31%. Calcd for CdC7H6N6O2 (MW=318.58): C, 26.39%; H, 1.90%; N, 26.38%.
